comments:
I have a Java class containing a main method. When I try to run it, by pressing 
the run button in the toolbar, the main method is found, but I cannot 
press "Finish". Or rather, when I press Finish, the dialog flashes away and for 
a short instant I can see the previous dialog ("Searching for main method"), 
and then the "Select Target" dialog reappears. I then cancelled out of the 
dialog, forgot about it, and when I a bit later tried the pulldown menu of the 
Run button, selecting this class (which was actually added to the list, even 
though it never run), I got a "Internal error, see log file" error message.

I suspect the real error occured previously when I wasn't able to run the 
class. I have no trouble running other classes. I have no idea what makes this 
class so special. I've tried looking at the preferences for the classes and the 
project, but can't notice anything different from other projects and classes 
which _do_ run.

Anyway, here's the log file:

It seems as this has something to do with a referenced project which was closed.

If I rebuild and tested to run, closed the referenced project and tested to 
run, rebuild and tested to run, reopened a referenced project and tested to 
run, and rebuilt and tested to run, I got varying results each time i tested to 
run. Most of them unsuccsessful -- only when both projects were open, and 
rebuilt in open state, I was successful in running.

I guess this is by design, though it is not obvious. (Especially the concept 
of "closed" projects is unclear.) Even so, the error messages should be more 
clear when having problems with closed projects.

I just noticed that I had auto build on resource modifications turned off. That 
at least explained why I got different results after manually building, even 
though the error messages still could be more informative.
Launching is owned by debugger. Moving ...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3847 ***
